Graduate Advising FAQ

by Sophie Engle on Aug 2013

This guide will answer several advising-related questions for MSCS and MSWS students.

Program Requirements


XKCD: Dependencies

What are the requirements for the Masters in Computer Science (MSCS) degree?

See http://www.usfca.edu/artsci/csg/ for details.

Students that do not have a CS background may have additional foundational requirements for their degree.

What are the requirements for the Masters in Web Science (MSWS) degree?

See http://www.usfca.edu/artsci/msws/ for details.

Students that do not have a CS background may have additional foundational requirements for their degree.

What are the college-wide graduate requirements for the College of Arts and Sciences?

See the General Catalog for details.

What is the required GPA for the MSCS or MSWS degrees?

Students must maintain a B average (3.0 GPA) on all degree requirements. Students that fall below this average will be placed on a academic probation. Students on academic probation who fail to raise their cumulative grade point average to 3.0 by the time they have completed the next six (6) credit hours of graduate work are subject to disqualification from the program. See the General Catalog for details.

Where do I get the requirements checklist form?

Click to download MSCS Requirements Checklist.
Click to download MSWS Requirements Checklist.

Keep in mind these are unofficial checklists provided for planning purposes.

Contact Information

Who do I contact for advising questions (e.g. courses, registration, holds, foundational requirements, etc.)?

You should contact the graduate adviser, Sophie Engle, via email at sjengle@cs.usfca.edu.

Who do I contact for admissions questions (e.g. admission requirements, test scores, scholarships, etc.)?

You should contact the graduate director, Terence Parr via email at gradadvisor@cs.usfca.edu.

Course Registration

How do I register for graduate courses?

You may register for graduate courses online in USF Connect. See this page for instructions. If you run into any holds that prevent you from registering for graduate courses, please contact the graduate adviser.

How do I register for undergraduate courses?

Since most of our undergraduate courses have prerequisite requirements, you will be unable to register for these courses the same way as graduate courses. There are two options for registering for undergraduate courses:

  1. You can contact the instructor of the class and ask to have your prerequisite requirement waived in USF Connect. Make sure you include your CWID/student ID number. The instructor can waive the prerequisite by logging into Banner, clicking the "Faculty Services" tab, and selecting "Registration Overrides".

    You must still enroll in the course. This process only waives the prerequisite requirement in the system, and does not actually register you in the course. Once the instructor confirms the requirement has been waived, you must still register for the course in USF Connect (see above).

  2. You may fill out an Registration Add/Drop Form (under the "Records and Registration" category). You must get the graduate adviser to sign the form, and then drop it off at the One Stop office.

Note that if you attempt to register for a course after the first week of class, you will need additional signatures to complete the registration process.

Who do I contact if I am having problems registering for courses?

You should contact the graduate adviser.

Elective Requirements

How many electives are required total?

For MSCS, you must have 5 elective courses or 20 units of electives total. For MSWS, you must have 3 elective courses or 12 electives total.

How many electives must be 600-level?

For MSCS, you must have 2 electives at a 600-level, even if you are enrolled in the Emphasis for Entrepreneurship. For MSWS, you must have ONE 600-level elective.

How many electives can be 200-level?

Only 1 elective may be 200-level, with permission of the graduate advisor. This is generally used to take CS 212 Software Development your first semester.

How many foundational requirements may be used as electives?

Only TWO foundational requirements may be used as electives. For example, if you have 4 foundational requirements, only 2 of those courses may be counted as electives. As such, you may need additional time to complete the Master's degree.

How many directed study or practicum units may be used as electives?

You may only use 8 units of directed study and practicum for electives.

How many units from the Emphasis in Entrepreneurship program can be used as electives?

The Emphasis in Entrepreneurship program replaces 2 courses or 8 units of CS electives. Note that you must still complete the required number of 600-level CS electives.

Practicum Option

What is the practicum option?

The practicum option allows students to gain practical experience in industry while earning credit towards their degree.

How many units is the practicum option?

The practicum option is 2 units per semester enrolled.

Do I need to pay tuition to take the practicum option?

Yes, the practicum is a 2 unit course, and you will be billed accordingly.

Is there a limit to the number of times I can take the practicum option?

Yes, you may enroll in a maximum of 8 practicum units total. Keep in mind, however, that only 4 practicum units may be used as an elective for your degree.

Do I get placed into an internship for the practicum option?

No, students are solely responsible for finding internships for the practicum. Faculty will not place students in internships.

I have an F-1 student visa. When am I eligible to take the practicum option?

International students are not eligible for their first 9 months (or 2 semesters). If you start in the fall semester, you will be eligible for practicum in the following summer semester.

What are the prerequisites for taking the practicum course?

Students must have an offer letter from their employer, and need a 3.3 GPA or above. If you are an international student, you must also provide a signed CPT letter to ISSS.

How do I enroll in the practicum course (including obtaining a Curricular Practical Training (CPT) letter)?

You must first contact the graduate adviser via email with a copy of your offer letter and contact information for your supervisor. If you also need a CPT letter for ISSS, include your name, start date, end date, graduation date, company name, number of units, and program. The format should be similar to:

'LiLi LuLu' 'June 20, 2013' 'August 11, 2013' 'June 2014' 'Google' '20' MSCS

You will be provided a signed CPT letter if necessary, which you then will need to take to ISSS along with an Add/Drop form. Otherwise, the you need to take an Add/Drop form to the graduate adviser to sign.

You SHOULD NOT register for the practicum course until you have followed the steps above!

Emphasis in Entrepreneurship

What is the Emphasis in Entrepreneurship?

Students enrolled in the entrepreneurship emphasis take a standard MSCS or MSWS degree, but take their electives in the top tier Entrepreneurship Program from the business school alongside MBA students.

How does the Emphasis in Entrepreneurship program affect my MSCS or MSWS degree?

You must still fulfill all of the requirements of the MSCS/MSWS programs, except that you will replace 8 units of CS electives with 8 units of MBA courses in the Entrepreneurship Program. Note that you must still complete the required number of 600-level CS electives.

How do I join the Emphasis in Entrepreneurship program?

You should contact the graduate adviser and express your interest in the program.

If approved, you will need to fill out a "Change of Academic Program" form (under "Records and Registration" at OneStop Forms) and get the necessary signatures.

What are the approved electives I may take as part of the Emphasis in Entrepreneurship program?

You may take any of the following classes:

  • MBA 6601 Entrepreneurial Management*
  • MBA 6603 Creativity and Innovation*
  • MBA 6605 Small Business Ventures*
  • MBA 6607 Corporate Entrepreneurship and Innovation*
  • MBA 6609 Internet Business Applications
  • MBA 6620 Silicon Valley Immersion

* Recommended Courses

How do I register for the approved Emphasis in Entrepreneurship electives?

You must first enroll in the Emphasis in Entrepreneurship program (see above). You will then be able to enroll in the approved MBA courses online. If you run into issues with registration, please email somgradadvisor@usfca.edu and CC the graduate adviser with your registration request. Your request will not be successful if you do not include BOTH email addresses!

Foundational Requirements

What are foundational requirements?

These are requirements you must take in addition to the requirements for the MSCS or MSWS degrees. These are courses that provide the foundation necessary for being successful in graduate-level courses in computer science.

Keep in mind that if you have more than 2 foundational requirements, you may not be able to complete your degree in 2 years.

How do I know if I have foundational requirements?

Foundational requirements are included on your offer letter. If you are unable to find your offer letter, please contact the graduate adviser.

When should I start satisfying my foundational requirements?

You should start satisfying your foundational requirements right away, as you generally need the skills taught in these courses for the other graduate-level courses. However, many foundational courses (except for CS 212 Software Development) may be full by the time you arrive at USF. As such, most students start taking foundational requirements during their second semester.

How many foundational requirements may be used as electives?

Only 2 foundational requirements may be used as electives. For example, if you have 4 foundational requirements, only 2 of those courses may be counted as electives. As such, you may need additional time to complete the Master's degree.

Do foundational requirements need to be taken at USF?

No, you may take these requirements at another reputable university if you wish. Please contact the graduate adviser to get approval before enrolling in courses at another institution.

Can I test out of the foundational requirements?

No, for the most part you may not test out of the foundational requirements. The only exception is CS 212 Software Development.

What do I do if I have an English course requirement?

You must take 4 units of English as a Second Language (ESL) courses. Generally, you can take these courses in addition to two CS courses. See the ESL Department for a list of courses.
